Este emprendedor está solicitando crédito  para cumplir sus sueño de acondicionar su vivienda para su familia lo cual comprara con el credito zinc, arena, cemento entre otros materiales de construcción.
texts.en: Jose Omar is a salaried worker who works at a business in his community. He is a homeowner and one of his biggest dreams is to remodel it but he has not done this for lack of money. He needs to make some urgent improvements since the rainy season is coming. This entrepreneur is asking for the loan to make his dream come true of remodeling his house for his family. He will buy zinc sheeting, sand and cement, among other construction materials.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheeting, sand, and cement, among other construction materials.

loans.name: Nella

texts.en:
Nella is 51, married, and has five children. She owns and operates a business selling food products in her local community. She has two years of experience in this business. Nella needs a loan of 1,500 WST to purchase new ingredients in order to expand her product offerings. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 WST per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2011, Nella joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Nella's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase new ingredients to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Alexandra Del Rocío

texts.es:
Alexandra tiene 33 años, se considera una mujer amable, trabajadora, sencilla y muy responsable con su familia. Alexandra vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en Atuntaqui que se encuentra a 15 minutos de Otavalo en la Provincia de Imbabura.

Alexandra trabaja sola en la crianza y venta de cerdos, en su negocio cuenta con 10 crías de cerdos y cerdos adultos de los cuales dos hembras. Es el tercer año consecutivo que trabaja con Fodemi, el crédito va a invertir en la adecuación y expansión de los corrales para sus chanchos ya que conforme va incrementando sus ventas ella invierte en la compra de más crías porque tiene una visión de ser una distribuidora mayoritaria, también el crédito utilizará en la compra de alimentación para sus chanchos.

El sueño de Alexandra es poder convertirse en una distribuidora para las grandes empresas.
texts.en:
Alexandra is 33 years old.  She is considered a friendly, hardworking, and simple woman who is very responsible with her family.  Alexandra lives with her husband and their two children in Atuntaqui, which is located 15 minutes from Otavalo in the Imbabura province.

Alexandra works raising and selling pigs.  Her business has 10 piglets and two female adult pigs.  

This is the third consecutive year that she has worked with Fodemi.  She will invest the loan in improving and expanding the pens for her pigs, since as her sales have increased, she has invested in the purchase of more piglets.  She has a vision of being a wholesale distributor.  She will also use the loan to purchase feed for her pigs.

Alexandra's dream is to become a distributor for large companies.

loans.use: to improve and expand her pig pens and purchase feed.

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. He is 48 years old and married with two children, ages 20 and 22. Rolly has been in the rice-farming business for 20 years. He earns 5,000 PHP per month doing farming. Rolly also tends a fish pond. He works hard to sustain his family and provide for his children's education.

Rolly needs a loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and fish feed. This will help improve Rolly's business profitability.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and fish feed.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 32 years old. He is married and has two children. He operates a motorcycle transport business. He has been in this business for the past four years.

This is Joseph's first loan with KADET after being introduced to the agency by a KADET officer. He will use the amount to purchase a secondhand motorcycle to help him boost his business and serve more clients. This will enable him to earn more income.

Joseph hopes to diversify and open a retail shop in his area in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 39 years old. He is married and has two children. He operates a hotel and has been in this business for eight years.

This is Bernard's first term loan with KADET after being introduced to the agency by a KADET officer. He will use the amount to purchase beans, rice and other grains for his hotel business.

Bernard hopes to own a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice and other grains for his hotel business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.es:
El señor Richard es un señor de 24 años está casado con la señora María del Carmen, juntos tienen un hijo pequeño viven en la comunidad de Monte Negro de la ciudad de Cochabamba, aun viven en la casa de sus padres en una sola habitación donde los tres se encuentran muy incomodos, su principal actividad del cliente es la fabricación de yeso,  el señor Richard esta continuando la actividad que desarrollaba su padre, mismo que le heredo todos sus hornos y sus herramientas para que continúe su actividad, el destino del crédito es para la compra de bolsas para el empaque y venta de yeso, el Señor Richard y su esposa son jóvenes pero muy responsable y trabajadores ya que están trabajando mucho para llevar adelante la actividad que tanto trabajo les costó a sus padres.
Entre sus sueños y metas esta construir su propia casa, ya que los padres del señor Richard también le heredo  un lote de terreno.
texts.en:
Richard is 24 years old and married to María del Carmen.  Together they have a young son and live in the community of Monte Negro in the city of Cochabamba, although they live in one room of his parent's house, where the three of them are very uncomfortable.

His main work is making plaster.  Richard is continuing the work that his father did, and he inherited all of his ovens and tools to continue his work.  He plans to use this loan to purchase bags to package and sell plaster.  Richard and his wife are young, but they are responsible and hardworking, since they are working very hard to carry on the business that his parents worked so hard for.  

One of his dreams and goals is to build his own house, since Richard's parents also left him a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase bags to package plaster.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia used her previous loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for planting in her farm. She was able to plant and harvest the seeds, enabling her to earn a nice profit. She paid all the loan payments on time for her previous loan.

This will be Sophia's second loan. She plans to use the amount to buy fertilizers and herbicides for planting during the planting season. She also plans to use part of it for land preparation and labor purposes. 

In the future, Sophia hopes to expand her farming business and earn more income, enabling her to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides for planting during the planting season.

loans.name: Echwa

texts.en:
Echwa is 54 years old married. He is blessed with eight children. Echwa owns a hotel, a business he started two years ago. He earns a monthly income of KES 12,000. 

Echwa has requested his first loan of KES 20,000 to purchase baking flour, maize, beans, rice and cooking fat for his hotel business. The anticipated profit will help him repay his loan and raise his standard of living.

Echwa dreams of buying his own piece of land and building a permanent house as well as educating his children.

loans.use: to purchase baking flour, maize, beans, rice and cooking fat for his hotel business.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
Hilaria es una mujer muy trabajadora, es madre de 2 hijos a los cuales quiere mucho y saca adelante con mucho esfuerzo y amor de madre, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Camana, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, hermosas playas y sobre todo por la amabilidad que caracteriza a sus pobladores; cuando Hilaria tiene un tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear con sus hijos y sobre todo comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo Saltado de Pollo. 

Día a día Hilaria salea trabajar en su negocio de venta de cañas de azúcar con mucho entusiasmo, es tan trabajadora e ingeniosa que ahora también ofrece el servicio de alquiler de celulares para realizar llamadas (como un locutorio ambulante); ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 60 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy carismática y trabajadora.

Hilaria está muy contenta y agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que es la segunda vez que le brindan grandioso apoyo, gracias a ello Hilaria podrá comprar más caña de azúcar, así ella podrá seguir ofreciendo sus productos y seguir creciendo como lo ha ido demostrando y seguir cada día esforzándose por cumplir su sueño.” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Hilaria is a hardworking woman who is the mother of two children who she loves very much and tries to get ahead with a lot of effort and mother's love.  She lives in the city of Camana, which is characterized by its warm climate, beautiful beaches, and the kindness of its people.  When Hilaria has free time, she likes to take walks with her children and eat one of her favorite dishes, the rich saltado de pollo (chicken stir-fry).  

Hilaria goes out every day to sell sugar cane with a lot of enthusiasm.  She is so hardworking and resourceful that she also offers a service that rents cell phones to make calls (like a traveling call center).  She works at her business about ten hours every day and she can help about 60 customers in a day.  She believes her business is doing well because she is very charismatic and hardworking.

Hilaria is very happy and thankful to the Kiva lenders since this is the second time she will benefit from their support.  Thanks to this loan, Hilaria will be able to purchase more sugar cane, so that she can continue offering her products and continue growing as she has demonstrated and continue working hard every day to meet her dream, which is to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to purchase sugarcane.

loans.name: Jaya Usaha Baluk Group

texts.en:
Jaya Usaha Baluk group is located in the suburbs. Most of its ten members have trading businesses or raise livestock. One is raising pigs. The group's new loan is for 20,000,000 IDR.
 
Ni Nengah, head of the group, is using her loan to buy a local sow. She already has a superior sow that is now pregnant. In the next two months it will give birth. She has a plan to become a piglets seller. Ni Nengah hopes this effort will be smooth so that she can realize her dream to make her kitchen more spacious.

loans.use: To buy a local sow.

loans.name: Enagnon 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ENAGNON 1 est formé de trois personnes qui sont membres d’une même famille. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Akouavi Amandine Aimée, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Akouavi Amandine Aimée est âgée de 37 ans. Akouavi Amandine Aimée est célibataire et n'a pas d'enfant. Akouavi Amandine Aimée assure seule ses différentes charges. Akouavi Amandine Aimée n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Akouavi Amandine Aimée exerce comme activité, la vente de tissus et des articles de mercerie. Akouavi Amandine Aimée s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Akouavi Amandine Aimée désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Akouavi Amandine Aimée sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ENAGNON 1, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Enagnon 1 group is made up of three people who are from the same family. The representative of the group, whose name is Akouavi Amandine Aimée, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. It is the fourth time that this group has requested financial aid from Alidé, with a view to increasing their business volume. Akouavi Amandine Aimée is 37 years old and single with no children. She covers her various expenses herself. She did not go to school and for the past ten years or so she has been selling fabrics and haberdashery products. She gets her supplies in a Benin market. With a view to responding better to customer demand, Akouavi Amandine Aimée would like to boost her activity. In order to do this she is, together with the other members of the Enagnon 1 group, requesting a fourth loan from Alidé. The previous loans were repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy fabric and haberdshery products

loans.name: Egadou Fioh Group

texts.fr: Le groupe EGADOU FIOH est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante de ce groupe, du nom de Abla Mawussé est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Abla Mawussé est âgée de 26 ans et est mariée à un peintre du nom de Richard. Le couple trois enfants dont deux sont à leur charge. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Abla Mawussé vit ensemble avec ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par les deux ensembles. Pour y parvenir, Abla Mawussé mène comme activité, la vente de vêtements et de chaussures dans une boutique au Benin. Abla Mawussé s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin et parfois à Lomé. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Abla Mawussé sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe EGADOU FIOH, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Egadou Fioh group is made up of three people who live in the same district. It is the fourth time that this group has requested financial aid from Alidé, with a view to increasing their business volume. The representative of this group, whose name is Abla Mawussé, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Abla Mawussé is 26 years old and married to a painter called Richard. The couple has three children, two of whom are dependents. All the children are educated. Abla Mawussé lives with her children. The couple cover the various household expenses between them. In order to manage this, Abla Mawussé sells clothes and shoes in a shop in Benin. She gets her supplies in a Benin market and sometimes in Lomé. With a view to satisfying customer demand and increasing her turnover and income, Abla Mawussé is, together with the other members of the Egadou Fioh group, requesting a fourth loan from Alidé. The previous loans were all repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Joilyn

texts.en:
Joilyn is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Joilyn has a shop in a rural market that sells seafood like shellfish, squid, shrimp and seaweed. She has had this business for four years. 

She requested a loan for 17,000 PHP to buy stocks of seafood like squid, shellfish and sea weed.

Joilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Joilyn hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of seafood like shellfish, squid and seaweed to sell.

loans.name: Renelda

texts.en:
Renelda is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Renelda has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for 16,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, powdered soap, bath soap, shampoo, cereals, creamer and beverages.

Renelda has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Renelda hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 31 years old. She is a single mother of one child. She sells cabbages and has been in the business for the past 15 years.

This is her first loan since she joined KADET. She will use the loan to purchase cabbages for resale.

She hopes to be a renowned farmer in her area.

loans.use: to purchase stock of cabbages.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace owns a clothes-selling shop in Nakuru town and has operated it for the last year. She is 23 years old and the mother of two children. 

She was introduced to KADET by one of the officers and this will be her first loan, with which she plans to buy more stock of ladies' dresses for resale in her business. 

In the future, Grace hopes to grow her business and open a boutique and also sell men's and children's clothing to make more income and provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mignonmide Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MIGNONMIDE est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Philomène est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Philomène est âgée de 37 ans et vit au Bénin. Philomène n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Philomène est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Iréné. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Philomène vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Philomène vend de nourriture (riz, haricot) et divers produits depuis une dizaine d’année à son domicile. Philomène s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Philomène sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MIGNONMIDE, un septième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les six premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Mignonmide group is made up of three people who live in the same district. The representative of this group, whose name is Philomène, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Philomène is 37 years old and lives in Benin. She did not go to school. She is married to a carpenter called Iréné. The couple has three children, all at school and in their care. Philomène lives with her husband and children. The couple cover the various household expenses between them. In order to cover the various expenses, Philomène has been selling food (rice, beans) and various other products from her home for around ten years. She gets her supplies in a Benin market. With a view to satisfying customer demand and increasing her turnover and income, Philomène is, together with the other members of the Mignonmide group, requesting a seventh loan from Alidé. The six previous loans were all repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and beans as well as condiments for sauces

loans.name: Triomphe De Ouanaminthe Group

texts.fr:
Dieumene est la coordonatrice de son groupe TRIOMPHE DE OUANAMINTHE. Elle n’est pas mariée elle a deux enfants. Dieumene habite dans la ville de OUANAMINTHE d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Dieumene a dirigé son business pendant les 7 dernières années. Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat du produits alimentaires. elle dirige un magasin d'alimentation. Dieumene espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business.

Les autres membres Les Triomphes ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, cosmetiques et des vetements.

Dieumene rêve est l’achat d’un camion pour transporter les marchandises.
texts.en:
Dieumene is the coordinator of her Triomphe de Ouanaminthe group. She is not married but has two children. She lives in the town of Ouanaminthe in Haiti, where electricity is rare and water very limited.

Dieumene has been managing her business for the past seven years. She would like to use this loan to invest in the purchase of food products. She manages a grocery store and hopes that this loan will help her to expand her business.

The other Les Triomphes members need a loan for businesses such as the sale of charcoal, cosmetics and clothing.

Dieumene's dream is to buy a lorry to transport her goods.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from Iraq. He is 46 years old, married and has four children.

Ali has owned a food market since 2003, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken and fishes and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knowledge of their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3000 loan in order to renovate his market. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to renovate his market.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 50-year-old single woman with three children. She sells bananas and has been in the business for the past 12 years.

This is her first loan after she was introduced to Kadet by a Kadet officer. She will use the loan to purchase stock of bananas for resale.

She hopes to be a renowned business woman in her area.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of bananas for resale.

loans.name: Nyamtuya

texts.en: Nyamtuya is 49 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a 'ger' (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His wife helps with the business and his elder child is employed while the younger one is a school student. He started his shoe retailing business in 2004 by renting a counter in Mongolia's biggest market. Over the years he gained many trusted suppliers and regular customers. He knows exactly what his customers want. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "Now that my children are old enough, it is time for me to concentrate on my business." He rented another counter in the market and he needs 3,000,000 MNT to buy more inventory.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en:
Ibtisam is a 43-year-old Lebanese woman. She’s married and lives with her husband and three school-aged children. She has joined forces with her husband in order to cover their life expenses and pay their children’s study costs. 

Ibtisam opened her own artificial flowers shop in 2011; she sells all colours and types of flowers as well. Today, she’s asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy added products for her shop such as flowers, ribbons, and many other related items. This will certainly increase the number of customers asking for her products and therefore increase her revenue. In the future, she plans to enlarge her shop by adding diverse kinds of flowers to it.

loans.use: to buy added products for her shop such as flowers, ribbons, and many other related items

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 44 years old and a single mother of three children. She has been operating a grocery business in Nakuru town now for the last 3 years. She sells cereals, bananas, vegetables and fruit and it has been very profitable as it has enabled her to provide for her family's needs. 

This will be her first loan and she plans to buy more cereals for resale. She also plans to buy more fruit and also expand the size of her selling stand due to the anticipated increase in stock. 

In the future, Mary hopes to invest more in her business and make more income and manage to open a grocery shop.

loans.use: To buy more cereals to stock

loans.name: Refuge De Dumas Group

texts.fr:
Cantave  est le coordinateur de son groupe Refuge de Dumas. Il est marié mais il a 5 enfants. Cantave habite dans la ville de Dumas d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Cantave a dirigé son business pendant les 6 dernières années.  Avant de commencer ce commerce, Il etait a l’ecole

Cantave voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat des boeufs. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business.

Des autres membres de les refuge ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz et du poisson.

Cantave dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteur constant. Il dit que ses buts principals sont l’augmantation du bussiness. Son rêve est l’achat d’une camion pour transporter les animaux.
texts.en:
Cantave is the coordinator of his Refuge de Dumas group. He is married and has five children. He lives in the town of Dumas in Haiti, where electricity is rare and water very limited. 

Cantave has managed his business for the past six years. Before he began trading he was at school. 

He would like to use this loan to invest in the purchase of oxen and hopes that the loan will enable him to expand his business.

The other members of the Refuge group need loans for businesses such as the sale of charcoal, rice and fish. 

Cantave says that his principal challenge is the constant lack of buyers. He says that his main aim is to expand his business and his dream is to buy a lorry to transport the animals.

loans.use: to buy oxen

loans.name: Abesamihigo C Group

texts.fr:
Silvère fait partie du groupe Abesamihigo. Il a 46 ans, il est marie avec 5 enfants de 4 ans à 14 ans, dont 4 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.
Silvère est agriculteur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est augmentée le volume de crédit demande pour finance son agriculture. Dans les prochaines années, Silvère voudrait être un meilleur producteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Silvère belongs to the Abesamihigo group. He is 46 years old and married with five children, ranging from four to 14 years old; four of the children are at school. He himself has six years of primary education.

Silvère is a rice farmer. This is his second loan from ACB and he is going to use this loan to buy chemical fertilizers and to cover labor costs.

His strategy for growing his business is to increase the amount of loans he is requesting in order to finance his farming. In the years to come, Silvère wuld like to be a more significant rice producer in his region. With the profits he makes, he is planning to pay for his children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 46-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and four children. They are all studying.  

He strives to work really hard in order to meet his family's needs and pay his children’s study fees.  

After many years of experience as a carpenter, Ali decided to open his own carpentry shop in 1996. He’s a reputable person who has gained a fair number of loyal customers so far. 

Today, he is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the needed quantity of wood for his work in addition to an electrical saw. He notes that this will improve his business and thus boost his productivity. 

In the future, he plans to take bigger projects and better develop his work.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of wood for his work in addition to an electrical saw.

loans.name: Hasnah

texts.en:
Hasnah is a 55-year-old Lebanese single woman. She lives with her parents and only one sibling. Unlike other women in her place, she helps her family in covering their expenses. She strives to work really hard and doesn’t hesitate to offer help whenever they need it. 

She has owned a minimarket since 1992. She succeeded at work especially after being very welcoming and friendly. 

Today, she wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase added provisions and products for her business. In that way, she will be able to carry on her work in a proper way. In the future, she plans to open her own supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase added provisions and products for her business.

loans.name: Alzamin

texts.en:
Alzamin is a 32-year-old married man. He has two children aged 3 & 5.

Alzamin is an experienced barber, and he rents a barber shop. He has been working in this sphere for twelve years and been successful at it. He also keeps animals in his yard and wants to develop the agriculture business. Now he has applied for a loan of 1600 AZN to buy ten sheep.

loans.use: To buy ten sheep.

loans.name: Fedeliza

texts.en:
Fedeliza is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Fedeliza has a shop that sells fish like "dalagang bukid", tilapia,"sap-sap", flying fish and milk fish. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy fish to sell like "lapu-lapu", "tam ban", and "galunggong".

Fedeliza has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Fedeliza hopes to improve her business so she can afford to educate her child.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell like "dalagang bukid," tilapia, and milk fish

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 61-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife. He has owned a bakery since 1971. Despite his older age, Ali works hard to be able to handle the heavy costs of living. His freshly prepared goods are enjoyed by members of his village and neighboring towns. With his requested loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will expand his business and purchase a new oven. In that way, he will be able to increase his productivity therefore his sales and thus his income. He is optimistic and always thinks positively about the future of his business.

loans.use: to expand his business and purchase a new oven.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity sells clothes in Nakuru town and has been in the business for the last 11 years. She is 44 years old and a single mother of 3 children. She sells dresses and blouses for women as well as children’s clothes and it has been very profitable. 

This will be her first loan and she plans to use the amount to buy a bale of children’s clothes. In the future, Charity hopes to grow her business and open a boutique.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Jose Toribio

texts.es:
Jose, tiene 58 años de edad, está casado, tiene 4 hijos entre 23 a 33 años de edad, vive en una aldea rural del municipio de Morazan, Yoro.
Don Jose, desde joven  se ha dedicado a la agricultura, cultiva granos básicos como maíz y frijoles para la venta y consumo. Esta es su única fuente de ingresos de los cuales aporta al hogar.
Esta solicitando un préstamo de 3,000.00 Lempiras para darle mantenimiento y preparar la tierra para cultivar frijoles, con esta inversión él espera mejorar las cosechas para obtener mejores ingresos.
Y sus planes son ampliar los cultivos cada año y superarse con un nivel de vida mejor.
Pertenece al grupo solidario Alvarenga, que está formado por 4 miembros, quienes viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la agricultura.
texts.en:
Jose is 58 years old and married.  He has four children between the ages of 23 and 33, and lives in a rural village in the municipality of Morazan, in Yoro.

Ever since he was young, Don Jose, has worked in agriculture.  He grows basic grains such as corn and beans for sale and for his own consumption.  This is his sole source of income, from which he supports his household.

He is requesting a loan of 3,000 lempiras to maintain and prepare his land for growing beans.  He hopes with this investment to improve his harvests to earn more income.

His plans are to expand his crops every year, and to achieve a higher standard of living.

He belongs to the communal bank group "Alvarenga", which is made up of four members who live in the same community and all work in agriculture.

loans.use: to maintain and prepare his land for growing beans.

loans.name: Alfredo Antonio

texts.es: Alfredo Antonio ya es cliente de Fundación León 2000, en el crédito anterior lo invirtió en productos para ofrecerles a sus cliente una variedad y así aumentar tanto sus productos como sus clientes. Durante el financiamiento ha mostrados ser responsable y sobre todo tiene objetivos bien definido para ir creciendo cada día en su negocio. En la actualidad el emprendedor está solicitando crédito para comprar cromo, sulfato de sodio, cloruro sódico entre otros productos que requiere el negocio.
texts.en: Alfredo Antonio is already a client of Fundación León 2000.  With his previous credit, he invested in products in order to offer his clients more variety and in that way increase his products as well as his client base.  During the phase of his first loan, he has proven to be responsible and above all he has clear objectives to continue growing his business every day.  Currently this businessman is asking for credit in order to buy chromium, sodium sulfate, sodium chloride and other products that his business requires.

loans.use: to buy chromium, sodium sulfate, sodium chloride and other products that his business requires.

loans.name: Valerie

texts.en:
Valerie is 37 years old and married with 8 children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Valerie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Valerie has been pig fattening for 8 years and also earns additional income from her general store and from buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Dato

texts.en:
Dato is 29 years old. He lives in a small village of Tskaltubo District, West Georgia with his family: his wife – Nina and two sons (2 and 1 years old). Dato works as operator at a local petrol station. Along with his job, Dato is actively involved in their family agricultural business. In particular, they have a small dairy farm with 3 milk cows. Dato and Nina produce cheese and sell it in the village. Total average monthly income of the family is 500 Laris. 

Dato requested credit for tilling and fertilizing the family-owned plot of land, where he will grow maize. He will dedicate harvested maize for family use, as well as for feeding the cows. The surplus will be sold in the village. He will rent a tractor for tilling the land, as well as purchasing fertilizers. Also, Dato will use part of the credit  for covering medical expenses, related to his son, who has health problems.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and rent a tractor

loans.name: Freiha

texts.en:
Freiha is a 31-year-old single woman living with her parents and four siblings. She has been working as a tailor for the past 10 years. She is very talented at her job and she works from her home. Her father is the main income provider of the family and she cooperates with him financially to allow her family members live in good conditions. 

Freiha is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to open her own tailoring shop and purchase needed equipment. In the future, she plans to take out more Kiva loans so as to further expand her business.

loans.use: to open her own tailoring shop and purchase needed equipment

loans.name: Abdel Karim

texts.en:
Abdel Karim is a 53-year-old Lebanese married man. He is living with his wife and four children; three of them are still attending school. He has been working as a taxi driver since 1996. In parallel, he owns a small shop in his town and he benefits from its rental fees.

 Due to lack of financial means, Abdel Karim decided to request a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l in order to perform the needed maintenance on his car to be able to carry on his business operation properly and safely. In the future, he plans to purchase a new car and hire a part-timer to work in it.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on his car

loans.name: Ilcia Maru

texts.es:
Ilcia, tiene 31 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos de 11, 9, 5 años y uno de 4 meses, vive en una aldea del municipio de Morazan, Yoro.
Ilcia ha crecido con una familia agricultora, desde hace 10 años  realiza su propia actividad agrícola, cultivando maíz y frijoles con el apoyo de su esposo. La motivación por realizar esta actividad es porque cada cosecha  le deja buena ganancia.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo de 3,000.00 Lempiras para darle mantenimiento de limpieza y preparación de la tierra de los cultivos de maíz y frijoles y mejorar las cosechas. Su plan es incrementar el área de cultivo para sacar más producción y obtener mayores  ganancias.
texts.en:
Ilcia is 31 years old and married.  She has four children, aged 11, 9, 5 and a four-month-old.  She lives in a village in the municipality of Morazan, in Yoro.

Ilcia has grown up in an agricultural family.  For the last ten years, she has had her own farming, growing corn and beans with the support of her husband.  Her motivation for doing this is that each harvest delivers good profits.

She is currently requesting a loan of 3,000 lempiras to maintain, clear, and prepare her farmland for corn and beans, and improve her harvests.  Her plan is to increase her cultivation are to achieve greater production and earn greater profits.

loans.use: to maintain, clear, and prepare her farmland for corn and beans.

loans.name: Filemon

texts.es:
Filemón tiene 62 años de edad, es casado, tiene 4 hijos de 30, 29, 23 y 22 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de San Pedro Sula, Cortes.
Don Filemón  tiene un negocio de una pequeña pulpería. Este negocio logro establecerlo con sus propios esfuerzos, trabajando y con la ayuda de su esposa que le ayuda a administrarlo. Don Filemón manifiesta que también con los prestamos que ODEF le ha otorgado ha podido tener estabilidad en su negocio manteniéndolo surtido y ofreciendo variedad de productos como, Granos básicos (harina, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maseca, manteca etc.) carnes, productos enlatados, producto de abarrotería y refrescos. 
Solicito su tercer préstamo de 25,000 lempiras para la compra de productos alimenticios como carnes, granos básicos entre otros. Así su inventario aumentara y generará  mas ganancias.
Su meta en el futuro es mejorar  aun  más su negocio, hacerle mejoras a su vivienda para darle mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Filemón is 62 years old and is married.  He has four children aged 30, 29, 23 and 22, and he lives in the city of San Pedro Sula, in Cortes.

Don Filemón has a business that is a small convenience store.  He was able to establish this business through his own efforts, working hard, and with the support of his wife who helps him to manage it.  Don Filemón demonstrates that with the loans that ODEF has provided to him, he has been able to have stability in his business, keeping it fully stocked and offering a variety of products for sale such as basics (flour, rice, beans, sugar, Maseca brand cornflour, butter, etc.), meat, canned products, grocery products and sodas.

He is requesting his third loan for 25,000 lempiras, for purchasing food products such as meat and basic grains, among other things.  In this way his inventory will increase and generate more earnings.

His goal for the future is to improve his business still further, and make improvements to his home to provide his family withe more comfort.

loans.use: to purchase food products such as meat and basic grains, etc., for sale in his business.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Liza has pit fattening business. She sells grown & matured pigs. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy animal feeds for the pigs like Purina, Pigrolac and Unifeeds.

Liza has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Liza hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for pigs like Unifeeds, Purina and Pigrolac

loans.name: Luis Anibal

texts.es:
Luis tiene 36 años, se considera una persona amable, alegre, responsable en su trabajo y con su familia. Luis vive en la provincia del Carchi con su esposa y sus dos hijos.

Luis trabaja solo en la crianza de ganado y producción de leche, este negocio ayuda a Luis a mantener su hogar, debido a que es su única fuente de ingresos. Luis realiza un nuevo crédito a Fodemi con el afán de invertir en la compra de dos terneras para criarlas y dedicarles a la producción de leche que por ahora es un negocio bueno para el y su familia, este proceso permitirá a Luis incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.

Luis sueña en construir su casa y seguir incrementando la producción de leche.
texts.en:
Luis is 36 years old and is considered a friendly and happy person who is responsible in his work and with his family. He lives in Carchi Province with his wife and two children.

Luis works alone raising cattle and producing milk. This business enables him to support his family since it is his only source of income. He has taken out a new loan from Fodemi with the aim of purchasing and raising two calves to use for milk production.  At present his business has been good for him and his family. The new calves will enable Luis to increase his income and improve his children’s quality of life.

Luis dreams of building his own home and of continuing to expand his milk production business

loans.use: to purchase two calves to raise.

loans.name: Ranalyn

texts.en:
Ranalyn is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Ranalyn has a shop that sells fish like milk fish, flying fish, dalagang bukid, lapu-lapu and sap-sap. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy stocks of fish like dalagang bukid, milk fish, flying fish and sap-sap.

Ranalyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Ranalyn hopes to improve her business for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell like dalagang bukid, tamban, sap-sap and milk fish

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Judith has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store. She buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 11,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, detergents, shampoo, creamer, powdered milk & beverages.

Judith has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Judith hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, milk, cereals, snacks, soap, detergents, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en: Jessie, a 57-year-old married mother of six, lives in the Philippines where she has been operating a shop selling vegetables such as pechay, squash, beans, radish and cucumber for five years. A new member of HSPFI, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more stocks of vegetables. Jessie hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fresh vegetables like radish, pechay, squash and cucumber.

loans.name: Olowolayema Group

texts.fr: Le groupe OLOWOLAYEMA est composé de trois personnes qui fréquentent la même église. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Françoise Médégnomi est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Françoise Médégnomi est âgée de 43 ans et vit au Bénin. Françoise Médégnomi a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Françoise Médégnomi est mariée à un jardinier du nom de Koudous. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Françoise Médégnomi vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Françoise Médégnomi vend depuis une dizaine d’année de la nourriture (pâte de maïs, riz, accompagné de sauce aux poissons) et des boissons fraîches au Benin. Françoise Médégnomi s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Françoise Médégnomi sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe OLOWOLAYEMA, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra surement de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et de se faire plus de profit.
texts.en:
The OLOWOLAYEMA group is made up of three people who all go to the same church. This is the first time that the group is seeking financial aid from ALIDé, in order to raise the level of its business.

Françoise Médégnomi, who is raising her hand in the photograph, is the group's representative. She is 43 years old and lives in Benin. She stopped her studies in primary school. Françoise Médégnomi is married to a gardener named Koudous. The couple has five children, all of whom have had schooling and live in their care. Françoise Médégnomi lives with her husband and children.

In order to cover the various family expenses, Françoise Médégnomi has been selling food (corn dough, rice, accompanied with a fish sauce) and cold beverages in Benin for about ten years now. She stocks up at a market in Benin.

Striving to satisfy her customers and grow her sales and revenue, Françoise Médégnomi, along with the other members of the OLOWOLAYEMA group, is seeking a loan from ALIDé. This loan will surely allow them to increase the level of their business and earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, fish, beverages, and condiments.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 44 years old, married to Grace, and they have 4 children. He sells food condiments like garlic and red onions in the marketplace and also supplies some to hotels and restaurants in Nakuru town. 

He was introduced to KADET by one of the existing clients and this will be his first loan application which he plans to use to buy more condiments for resale. 

In the future, Godfrey hopes to grow his business and sell as well as supply condiments to traders and other markets hence make more income.

loans.use: To buy more condiments for food

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married and has five children.

Hussein is a barber, and in 2000 he opened his own shop, where he offers shaving and massage services. He has more than ten years' experience in this field and has a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $1800 loan to renovate and redecorate his shop. He is aiming to earn more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate and redecorate his shop.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, 51 years old, lives in a village of the Terjola District with his 14-year-old daughter and mother-in-law. Working as a stone mason in the village, David has a small workshop where he carries out the orders of villagers. His mother-in-law heads the agricultural business of the family, taking care of two milk cows and producing on average 50 kg of cheese per month, 40 kg of which is sold on the local open market. Total average family monthly income is 750 Laris.

George is requesting this loan to purchase eight sheep. The start-up of a new business will allow George to sell lambs as well as a small amount of sheep cheese. The income of the family will increase, allowing for improvements in their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase eight sheep.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is 40 years old and is a married woman with 4 children ages 9, 11, 18 and 21. She is in the business of raising hogs. Rowena earns 4000 PHP per month with her business. She requested a loan to purchase piglets and feeds. Rowena is hoping for her business to grow and for her family's standard of living to improve. Rowena plans to use any extra income to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feeds

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Severina owns and manages a sari-sari (variety) store business in Trinidad, Bohol. Severina is a married woman with 5 children. Her husband is a seaweed farmer.

Severina sells various items like spices, vinegar, soy sauce, toiletries and canned goods. She earns 15,000 PHP per month with her business. Severina works hard to provide for their household needs and keep her family healthy. She has requested a loan to buy more merchandise to sell such as rice, soft drinks and canned goods. This will help increase Severina's business profitability.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell such as rice, soft drinks and canned goods

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is 40 years old. She lives in a small village of Terjola District with her family: her husband – Arvelodi and three daughters (19, 17 and 12 years old). Her younger daughters go to school and the eldest one helps her parents in the family agriculture business. The family has 2 milk cows. Lali produces cheese and sells it in the village. Also the family has 500 grape vines. Arvelodi produces wine and sells it in the village. 

The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris. Lali requested credit for purchasing 12 sheep. She will sell the lambs. The new business initiative will increase the income of the family. They will be able to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 12 sheep

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 28 years old and married with one child. He sells motor vehicle spare parts to earn a living. He has been in the business for 6 years and describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy motor vehicle spare parts to sell.

loans.use: To buy motor vehicle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Lolognon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LOLOGNON est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Akuvie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Akuvie est âgée de 36 ans et vit au Bénin. Akuvie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Akuvie est mariée à un pêcheur du nom de Abraham. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Akuvie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Akuvie vend depuis quinze ans, de la nourriture (pâte de maïs ; riz) et de façon secondaire des produits divers dans sa région. Akuvie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Akuvie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe LOLOGNON, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Lolognon group is made up of three people who live in the same district. The representative of the group, whose name is Akuvie, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Akuvie is 36 years old and lives in Benin. She did not attend school. She is married to a fisherman by the name of Abraham. The couple has four children, who are all at school and in their care. Akuvie lives with her husband and children. The couple cover the various household expenses between them. In order to cover the different household expenses, Akuvie has been selling food (corn paste, rice) for the past 15 years, and, as a secondary activity, she sells other products in her region. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. With a view to satisfying customer demand and increasing both her turnover and income, Akuvie is now requesting a loan from Alidé, along with the other members of the Lolognon group.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn and rice

loans.name: Wilfrid Dododji

texts.fr: Wilfrid Dododji est âgé de 30 ans et vit au Bénin. Wilfrid Dododji est marié à une coiffeuse du nom de Rosaline. Le couple a quatre enfants à leur charge dont trois représentent leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Wilfrid Dododji n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de la famille, Wilfrid Dododji exerce la coiffure depuis douze ans dans son atelier. Grâce au revenu que lui génère ce métier, Wilfrid Dododji contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Wilfrid Dododji sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Wilfrid Dododji is 30 years old and lives in Benin. He is married to a hairdresser by the name of Rosaline. The couple has has four children in their care, three of whom are their own children. The children are all at school and live with their parents. The couple covers the various household expenses between them. Wilfrid Dododji did not attend school. In order to provide for the various needs of his family, he has been a hairdresser with his own salon for the past twelve years. Thanks to the income which he generates from this profession, he is able to contribute to the various household expenses. With a view to satisfying the demand of his ever-growing customer base, Wilfrid Dododji is requesting a fourth loan from Alidé. The three previous loans were all repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy hair clippers, chairs, etc.

loans.name: Kareem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 48 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom works. 

Kareem has owned a food market since 2010, selling soft drinks, juice, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken, fish, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas. 

He is requesting a $1200 loan in order to purchase a tricycle and to add more foodstuffs. He aims to make more money to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a tricycle and more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Kazem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 39 years old, married and has two children. 

Kazem is a blacksmith; in 2005 he opened his workshop for blacksmithing. He has sufficient experience in this field. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas. 

He is requesting a $3000 loan in order to renovate his workshop. He aims to make more money to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate his workshop.

loans.name: Kahindi

texts.en: Kahindi is a 34-year-old married man. He has three children and all are enrolled in school. Kahindi sells charcoal at the market. He's worked in this business for four years. His primary customers are locals and passersby. He describes his greatest business challenge to be transporting the charcoal and his highest monthly expense is food. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Kahindi will use the 30,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. Kahindi aspires to open another kiosk in the future. He joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 57 years old, married and has two children, one of whom works. 

Ali has owned a coffee shop since 1992, offering soft drinks and all types of hot drinks. 

He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area. 

He applied for a $2400 loan in order to redecorate his shop. He aims to make more money to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to redecorate his shop.

loans.name: Fadel

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 57 years old, married and has two children who both work.

Fadel has been an owner for a food market since 2002, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken and fish, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3000 loan in order to make a sliding door and an outdoor ceiling, to purchase a showcase and a fridge and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to earn more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to make a sliding door and an outdoor ceiling, purchase a showcase and a fridge and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married, and has one child and lives with six family members; two of them work.

Ziad has been a tailor since 2010; he makes, repairs, or alters clothing professionally such as suits, coats and trousers for men. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to purchase a large electric generator. He is aiming to earn more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To purchase a large electric generator.

loans.name: Roland

texts.en:
Roland is 40 years old. He lives in Terjola District with his family: his wife – Maya, his 17-year-old son, 15-year-old daughter, his mother (retired) and his brother. The children go to school. Roland’s brother has health problems and he receives a relevant pension from the government. Roland and Maya are leading the agricultural business of the family. They have 2 milk cows and 12 sheep. Maya produces cheese and sells it in the village. Also the family has 400 grape vines. Roland produces wine and sells it in the village. Total average monthly income of the family is 1000 GEL. 

Roland requested credit for purchasing 10 -11 sheep. The expansion of the business will allow the family to sell more lambs and the income of the family will increase. Roland plans to reinvest it in the same business to expand it and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Josephat is 41 years old, married, and blessed with six children, four of whom are in school. He has been running a grocery store for eight years and also has a retail shop. He has been able to grow his business with the financial support of Faulu Kenya.

Now requesting a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy bananas, kale, onions and tomatoes, Josephat dreams of opening a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: to buy bananas, kale, onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Ross Neri

texts.es:
Ross N. es una mujer de 37 años de edad, es una mujer viuda y con 2 hijos como carga familiar. Vive en casa propia junto a sus hijos, la cual está ubicada en Caserío Jesús Del Valle en el distrito de Tambogrande. Ross vive en la parte rural  de este distrito, pero cuenta con servicios básicos.
La actividad que desarrolla Ross es la crianza de ganado menor como ovinos y aves de corral (gallinas, pavos), los cuales cría y engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local. Además se dedica a la venta de harina para la preparación de chicha tiene clientela conocida en la zona. Dichas actividades le han generado importantes ingresos para el mantenimiento de sus hijos y para elevar su calidad de vida.
El monto del crédito solicitado es de 2000 nuevos soles, crédito será la compra de alimentos para animales y realizar mejoras en su corral, poner techo por periodo lluvioso. Esto permitirá que desarrollen en buenas condiciones  y así venderlos a un mejor precio en el mercado local, por lo tanto, generar mayor ganancia. Esta inversión le permitirá a Ross seguir creciendo en su negocio y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ross N. is a 37 year old widow with two children who are dependent on her. She lives in her own home with her children. Her house is located in Jesús Del Valle Settlement in Tambogrande Disrict. Ross lives in the rural part of this district, which now has basic services.

Ross raises small animals such as sheep, chickens and turkeys, which she fattens to sell at the local market. She also sells flour for the preparation of chicha (maize liquor) and has customers throughout the area. These businesses have generated sufficient income to support her children and elevate their quality of life.

Ross has applied for a loan of S/. 2,000, which she will use to purchase feed for the animals and to make improvements on their corral, erecting a roof for rainy periods. This will enable them to grow in better conditions so that she can sell them at a higher price at the local market, thereby earning a greater profit. This investment will enable Ross to continue expanding her business and improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her small animals and to make improvements on their corral.

loans.name: Rezo

texts.en:
Rezo lives in a small village of Tskaltubo District. He is 65 years old and lives with his family: his wife Galina, his 20-year-old son, and a daughter-in-law. 

Rezo leads the agricultural business of the family. In particular, he grows greens, cucumbers, and tomatoes in a family-owned greenhouse with a total area of 360 sq. meters. Along with the abovementioned Rezo grows greens on a family-owned 0.15 hectare plot. He sells the harvest on a local wholesale market. Rezo's son is a worker in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 900 Laris. 

Rezo requested credit for the renovation of his greenhouse. He will purchase wooden materials for replacing existing damaged pillars and a polyethylene cover, as the old one was already torn and couldn't maintain the necessary temperature. The renovated greenhouse will give better a harvest to the family and they will be able to sell it for a higher price. The income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase wooden materials and polyethylene cover for greenhouse renovation

loans.name: Jawad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 44 years old, married and has three children; two of them work.

Jawad is a blacksmith; in 1994 he opened his car workshop as a blacksmith. He has more than fifteen years' experience in this field, a good reputation and he is becoming well known in his area.

He applied for $1200 loan in order to purchase an electric generator for his workshop. He is aiming to earn more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase an electric generator for his workshop.

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Florence is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is single and has two children, both of whom are in school. For the past two years, she has been working hard to manage her small charcoal-selling business.

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more charcoal for resale, which will help her to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house upon it.

Florence is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Florence's future prospects by helping her to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Jorge Manuel Vicente

texts.es:
Jorge Manuel tiene 60 años de edad es casado tiene dos hijas, vive con los hijas de 24 y 16 años de edad Y LA ESPOSA en Quito provincia del Pichincha.

Jorge es Taxista pertenece a una compañía de taxis "NUEVOS HORIZONTES", realiza carreras por toda la ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para invertir para comprar dos  aros, 1  gata, 2 llantas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los repuestos y trabajar sin ningún inconveniente.

Las compras lo hará en Quito. El sueño  es poder seguir progresando y tener una casa,  además de sacar adelante los estudios de la segunda hija. 

El desafío al que se enfrenta es trabajar duro y diariamente para el bienestar de la familia. En el tiempo libre le gusta leer, hacer deporte
texts.en:
Jorge Manuel, 60, is married and has two daughters.  He lives with his daughters, 24 and 16, and his wife in Quito, province of Pichincha.  Jorge is a taxi driver for a taxi company.  He makes trips throughout the city.

He is requesting the loan to invest in buying two rims, a jack, and two tires.  With the help of the loan he will be able to buy the parts and to work without any problem.  He will make the purchase in Quito.

His dream is to be able to continue getting ahead and to have a house, as well as to give his second daughter a good start in her studies.  The challenge he faces is to work hard every day for the well-being of his family.  In his free time he likes to read and play sports.

loans.use: to buy two rims, a jack, and two tires.

loans.name: Kamel

texts.en:
This borrower, from Iraq, is 45 years old, married and has five children. Since 2002, Kamel has owned a shop selling spare parts for cars. With ten years of experience in this field, he enjoys a good reputation and is well-known in the area.

Kamel is requesting a $2100 loan in order to make additional shelves and pay for an advertising lighting box and an aluminum showcase. He is striving to earn more profits to provide a better life for his entire family.

loans.use: to make additional shelves and pay for an advertising lighting box and an aluminum showcase.

loans.name: Sedjro 3 Group

texts.fr: SEDJRO 3 est un groupe constitué de cinq personnes dont les membres sont des amies. La représentante, (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Pélagie. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Pélagie est âgée 31 ans et est mariée à un certain Wilfrid. Le couple a deux enfants à leur charge. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Pélagie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure avec son mari les charges de la maison. Pélagie a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Pour satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Pélagie vend des mèches et des produits cosmétiques dans une boutique depuis près de quatre ans. Pélagie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Ce prêt permettra certainement à Pélagie et à son groupe SEDJRO 3 de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Le premier crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group SEDJRO 3 consists of five members who are also friends. They are seeking a second loan from ALIDé to bolster their working capital. The group’s representative is Pélagie, seen with her hand raised in the photo. Pélagie, age 31, is married to a man named Wilfrid. The couple have two dependent children, both in school. Pélagie lives with her husband and their children, and the couple handle the household responsibilities together. Pélagie attended high school.

To help provide for the family’s needs, Pélagie has been selling hair extensions and cosmetic products out of a shop for nearly four years. She buys her merchandise at a market in Benin.

This loan will help Pélagie and the other members of SEDJRO 3 to strengthen their activities, to expand their customer base, and to increase their revenue. The previous loan they obtained was repaid without incident.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and cosmetic products for resale.

loans.name: Carlos Ramon

texts.es:
Carlos Ramón tiene 23 años de edad, tiene dos hijos es casado vive en la ciudad de Guaranda Provincia Bolívar.

Carlos Ramón es maestro da Inglés en una escuela primaria. 
Solicita el crédito para realizar arreglos en su vivienda para comprar puertas, ventanas, cambiar el techo, etc.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá mejorar su vivienda haciendo los arreglos requeridos.

El sueño es poder comprar un vehículo para la familia.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es seguirse superando cada día para el bienestar propio y de su familia.

En el tiempo libre le gusta realizar deporte como jugar futbol y vóley boll.
texts.en:
Carlos Ramón, 23, has two children; he’s married and lives in the city of Guaranda, Bolívar Province.  He works as an English teacher.  

He’s asking for a loan to do some home improvements like installing doors, windows, replacing the roof, etc.  With help from the loan he will be able to do the needed improvements.  

His dream is to be able to buy a vehicle for the family.  The challenge he faces is to continue improving himself every day for his and his family’s wellbeing.  In his free time he likes playing sports like soccer and volleyball.

loans.use: to purchase doors, windows, and to change the roof of his home

loans.name: Norma Rocio

texts.es:
Norma Roció tiene 24 años de edad es soltera vive con sus familiares en Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar.
Norma Roció es empleada domestica.

Solicita el crédito para la compra un computador y una impresora para facilitar la realización de los trabajos  requeridos en sus estudios.
La compra del producto la realizarà en la ciudad de Guaranda.
Su sueño es ponerse su propio Cyber para beneficio personal.
Los desafíos a los cuales se enfrenta es la culminación de sus estudios  siendo reconocida como una excelente alumna.
En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte como básquet etc.
texts.en:
Norma Roció, 24, is single and lives with her family in Guaranda in the province of Bolívar.
Norma Roció is a domestic employee.
She is requesting this loan to buy a computer so she can do the homework required in her studies. 
She will purchase the equipment in Guaranda. 
Her dream is to start her own internet services business for personal gain.
The challenge she faces is being recognized as an excellent student when she finishes her studies. 
In her spare time, she enjoys sports like basketball.

loans.use: to purchase a computer and a printer

loans.name: Milciades

texts.es:
El Sr. Milciades es soltero, y aun no tiene hijos. Tiene un pequeño taller ubicado en la ciudad de Lambaré, empezó de muy niño trabajando con su padre que también tiene la misma profesión.
Empezó pasando herramientas a su padre y sus compañeros, luego de a poco y mientras pasaban los años su padre le fue enseñando todos los secretos de la mecánica automotriz. Ya en el año 2008 se decide y se independiza, empezando con pocas herramientas pero muchas ganas de trabajar. De a poco y gracias a su trabajo está logrando equipar su negocio.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de un compresor, el cual lo quiere utilizar en su taller para poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Milciades is single and still does not have children.  He has a small shop located in the city of Lambaré.  When he was very young he began working with his father, who also has the same profession.

He began handing tools to his father and his coworkers.  Then, little by little and as the years passed, his father began teaching him all the secrets of auto repair.  Finally, in 2008, he made up his mind and became independent, beginning with few tools but a lot of desire to work.  Gradually, and thanks to his work, he is managing to equip his business.

He is requesting the loan to buy a compressor, which he will use in his shop to be able to give his customers better service.

loans.use: to buy a compressor for his shop.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Guapa es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, se encuentra en el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación Paraguaya. Ellas son mujeres con muchas ganas de salir adelante y ayudarse las unas a las otras, por medio del trabajo en conjunto. 
Isabel forma parte de este grupo y ella nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de ropas usadas de todo tipo, en lo cual le va muy bien, ya que la ropa de segunda mano es muy solicitada últimamente porque es más económica. Isabel quiere seguir trabajando y es por ello que solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y ofreciendo variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee named "Kuña Guapa" is from the city of Curuguaty. They are in their first loan cycle with the Program of Women Entrepreneurs at Fundación Paraguaya. These women have tremendous desire to succeed and help one another. They perform their work together as a group.

Isabel is a member of this group and says that she sells used clothing of all types. She has done very well since lately there has been plenty of demand for secondhand clothing because it is more affordable. Isabel wants to continue working, so she is requesting a loan in order to buy clothes. She will be able to continue her work and offer variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
El Señor. Ismael tiene 56 años, vive en de la ciudad de Paraguarí, está casado con la Señora María con quien tienen 5 hijos, todos ellos ya mayores.
El Señor Ismael nos comentó que empezó a trabajar en construcción hace aproximadamente 30 años, empezó como ayudante albañil y hace 20 años que empezó a trabajar en forma independiente por toda la zona de Paraguarí y alrededores. El es una persona muy trabajadora y con ganas de seguir trabajando para poder ayudar con los gastos de la casa.
Solicitó el préstamo para el cambio de su vehículo, ya que es su medio de transporte a la hora de hacer sus trabajos y le facilitará mucho al transportar sus herramientas.
texts.en:
Ismael is 56 years old and lives in the city of Paraguarí. He is married to María, with whom he has five children, all of which are grown up. Ismael started to work in construction approximately 30 years ago. He started as an assistant bricklayer and twenty years ago he started to work independently in the zone of Paraguarí and the surrounding areas. He is a very hardworking person and wishes to continue working to help cover the household expenses.

He requested the loan to get a new vehicle, since it is how he gets around to do his work and it would make his work easier to be able to transport his tools.

loans.use: to purchase a new vehicle.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité está empezando pero se la buena predisposición de todas para formarse y realizar actividades juntas.   Todas son vecinas y no tienen ningún problema para reunirse y realizar actividades para el progreso de todas. El objetivo de cada una es poder salir adelante en cada una de sus actividades y también poder sobresalir como grupo. 
Mirtha es una de las miembros, ella es muy trabajadora y cuenta que se dedica a la venta de carbón. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que últimamente el carbón es muy solicitado. Mirtha nos comenta que su sueño es poder seguir progresando y de esa forma poder mejorar sus ingresos y seguir ayudando a su familia. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carbón, para poder tener en stock y que no le falte para cuando sus clientes se lo pidan.
texts.en:
The committee is now beginning but they are happy to be forming the group and having businesses together.  All are neighbors and don't have any problems meeting and working for everyone's progress.  Each one has the objective of getting ahead in their businesses and also to succeed as a group.
Mirtha is one of the members.  She is very hardworking and tells us that she sells charcoal.  She has a good customer base since lately charcoal is in much demand. She says that her dream is to continue progressing and in that way to be able to improve her earnings and to keep on helping her family.
She is requesting the loan to buy charcoal so that she will have stock and be able to supply her customers when they order.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Reseda Group

texts.es:
El comite de reseda son todas de la zona de San Lorenzo, son muy unidas es un grupo muy antiguo y ellas son muy trabajadoras y unidas por sobre todo se ayudan siempre y en el barrio mismo. Semanalmente se reunen para los pagos y actividades que van realizando cada mes.
Vicenta es la presidenta del grupo, y ella nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de plantas. Comenta que tiene una gran variedad de plantas que son solicitadas por muchas personas. Gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante y de esa forma poder ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de plantas silvestres, con lo cual podrá tener más variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes para la venta.
texts.en:
All of the members of the committee named "Reseda" are from the District of San Lorenzo. Being a long-time group, the members are very close. They are hard workers who always help one another and those in their neighborhood. The members meet on a weekly basis to submit their payments and plan the activities that they will carry out each month.

Vicenta is the group president. She says that she sells all types of plants. Vicenta offers a wide variety of plants that are requested by many people. Thanks to her efforts, she has been able to move forward and help her family. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy wild plants, which will provide greater variety that she can sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy wild plants to sell.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
15 mujeres de la ciudad de Luque se unieron con el deseo de poder trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo ayudarse las unas a las otras. 
La sra. Lilian tiene un comercio de lenceria y electronica vive con sus hijas de14 años y de 11 años . Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y no tiene miedo a ningun trabajo es por ello que hace de todo.  Ella solicita  el credito  para la compra de productos varios, como ser  ropas, lenceria, celulares y articulo de electronicas, con lo cual podrá tener una buena cantidad de productos en stock.
Lilian tiene como meta ir agrandando su negocio y  brindando asi un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
15 women from the city of Luque got together with the hope of working and helping each other.

Mrs. Lilian has a lingerie and electronic store. She lives with her two daughters who are 14 and 11 years old. She is a very hard worker and is not afraid of any type of work which is why she does everything. Mrs. Lilian needs the loan to buy different products like clothing, lingerie, cell phones, and electronic products which will allow her to have more good quality merchandize in stock.

As a goal, Lilian wants to keep improving her business and to give her family a better quality of life.
